A brown shiny element X turns black when heated in the presence of air. Tell the name of this element X and that black colored compound?
Burning of Magnesium Ribbon in Air || Combination Reaction & Exothermic Reaction || Class 10 Science
Items.Description:
Activity based learning 
In this video, we perform a simple and important Class 10 Science experiment – Burning of Magnesium Ribbon in Air.
When magnesium ribbon is heated, it burns with a dazzling white flame to form magnesium oxide (MgO), which is a white powder.

This reaction is an example of:

✅ Combination Reaction

✅ Exothermic Reaction

Activity Steps:

Take about 5 cm long magnesium ribbon.

Clean it by rubbing with sandpaper to remove oxide coating.

Hold the ribbon with tongs and heat over a burner flame.

The magnesium ribbon starts burning with a bright white flame.

Collect the white powder (MgO) formed in a watch glass.

⚠️ Precaution: The dazzling bright light is harmful for eyes. Always maintain a safe distance from the flame or wear protective glasses.

👉 This activity demonstrates important concepts of chemical reactions and is a must-know experiment for Class 10 students.
